q_en: What is the progress of sewing tasks for William?
gt:
Hello there! üòÑ Let's take a look at the progress of sewing tasks for our customer, William.

Based on the data we have, here's a summary of the sewing tasks:

| Order Product ID | Number of Products | Completed Quantity |
|------------------|--------------------|--------------------|
| 28               | 210                | 585 (Total)        |
| 29               | 180                |                    |
| 30               | 195                |                    |

The total number of products required for William's orders is 585, and the total completed quantity of sewing tasks is also 585. üéâ This means all the sewing tasks for William's orders have been completed! Great job to the team! üßµ‚ú®

If you have any more questions or need further details, feel free to ask! üòä

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'William';
steps.description: Retrieve the customer ID for the customer with the name "William"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE user_id = '8';
steps.description: Retrieve the order IDs for the customer "William"

steps.sql: SELECT id, number FROM order_product WHERE order_id IN (8);
steps.description: Retrieve the order_product IDs and the number of required products for each order

steps.sql: SELECT SUM(completed_number) FROM sewing_tasks WHERE order_product_id IN (28, 29, 30);
steps.description: Retrieve the total completed quantity of all sewing tasks corresponding to the products in the orders

steps.sql: SELECT SUM(number) FROM order_product WHERE id IN (28, 29, 30);
steps.description: Calculate the total quantity of products in the orders
